articles.title: Trump Imposes Massive Fee Hike on H-1B Visa Applications
articles.summary: President **Trump** signed a proclamation requiring employers to pay **$100,000** for new **H-1B visa** applications, up from the current **$215** lottery fee. The program allows US companies to hire foreign workers in technical fields like **IT and engineering**. This dramatic increase targets the visa system that helped launch major tech leaders.

articles.title: Cyber Attack Disrupts Major European Airports for Second Day
articles.summary: **Heathrow** and other European airports face a second day of disruption after a **cyber-attack** knocked out check-in and baggage systems. **Brussels Airport** and others resorted to **pen and paper** boarding on Saturday. Hundreds of flights were delayed as the software used by several airlines failed across the continent.

articles.title: Russia Launches Massive Aerial Attack Across Ukraine Killing Three
articles.summary: At least **three people** were killed and over **30 injured** in a massive overnight **Russian aerial attack** on Ukraine, President **Zelensky** says. Multiple regions were targeted as part of a deliberate strategy to intimidate civilians and destroy infrastructure, with one direct missile hit on a residential area reported.

articles.title: Trump Publicly Urges Justice Department to Prosecute Political Enemies
articles.summary: President **Donald Trump** publicly urged the **US Justice Department** to charge his political enemies during an **Oval Office** speech on September 19. The unprecedented call for prosecutions marks a significant escalation in Trump's rhetoric against opponents, raising concerns about the independence of federal law enforcement agencies under his administration.

articles.title: US House Lawmakers Make Rare Visit to China for Talks
articles.summary: **US House lawmakers** made a rare visit to **Beijing** to meet with Chinese Premier **Li Qiang** in efforts to stabilize bilateral ties. The delegation discussed contentious issues including **TikTok** regulations and trade relations. This marks the first congressional visit to China in over **eighteen months** amid ongoing tensions.

articles.title: Dutch Police Clash with Anti-Immigration Protesters in The Hague
articles.summary: Dutch police used **teargas** and **water cannon** to disperse violent anti-immigration protesters in **The Hague** on Saturday. **Thirty arrests** were made and **two officers** were injured during the confrontation. Local government officials condemned the violence as rightwing demonstrators clashed with law enforcement in the city center.

articles.title: Trump Trade War Pushes American Farmers to Financial Brink
articles.summary: **US farmers** face dire consequences from **Trump's trade war** as tariffs devastate agricultural exports. A former farmer turned **congresswoman** warns that many farms are no longer viable due to retaliatory tariffs from **China** and other trading partners. The agricultural sector struggles with mounting debt and declining commodity prices nationwide.

articles.title: UN High Seas Treaty Takes Effect After Sixty Countries Ratify
articles.summary: The **UN High Seas Treaty** will take effect in early **2026** after **60 countries** ratified the agreement on Friday. The treaty establishes a new **Conference of the Parties** to protect marine biodiversity in international waters. Implementation begins after a legally required **120-day** waiting period for conservation efforts.

articles.title: UK Charity Closures Surge Seventy-Five Percent Amid Crisis
articles.summary: **Charity closures** in the UK have soared by **three-quarters** as stalling donations and the cost of living crisis take their toll. **Oxfam** warned that charities are being asked to do more with less when people need them most. The organization put **265** of its **2,100** staff at risk of redundancy.

articles.title: Piracy Surges in Malacca Strait Threatening Asian Shipping Routes
articles.summary: **Pirate attacks** and sea robberies have surged in the **Malacca Strait**, a critical shipping lane between the **Middle East** and **East Asia**. The narrow waterway serves as a choke point for energy shipments to Asian economies. Maritime security experts warn of increasing threats to commercial vessels navigating these waters.

dailyGreeting: Good morning! Global tensions dominate today's critical headlines.

historicalEvents.description: French National Convention votes to abolish monarchy
Belize gains independence from United Kingdom
Deep Space 1 flies within 2,200km of Comet Borrelly
